data.title: Good sercive
data.text: I tried Naples for the first time on Friday night. I sat at the bar and had good service from the bartenders. Great atmosphere.

data.title: Flatbread!
data.text: Just finished dining at Naples Flatbread and Wine Bar. We tried the sundried tomato hummas with warm naan and the Pietro flatbread, both were excellent. Started with a Caesar, very good. Margarita and wine selection was good and enjoyed conversation with the staff, everyone was very personable.

data.title: Hannah
data.text: We got the Margherita pizza and it was ok. Decently good and big for the price! However our waitress Hannah was awesome and made the experience really fun! Ask for her if you go!

data.title: Lunch Break
data.text: Was in town for some work and this establishment was within walking distance to our hotel. Great salad and they even had a gluten free option of flatbread...score!

data.title: A nice quiet place for dinner.
data.text: We frequently eat at Naples Flatbread prior to a performance at the PAC. We have always had good service and good food although we haven't tried anything but the Flatbreads on their menu. One of the reasons we like Naples is that it is quiet enough to have a conversation without shouting. They have a good selection of wines and beers and a nice varied menu but as I mentioned we seem to always order one of the flatbreads. The Bistecca is our favorite but we have enjoyed all we have tried. Much of the menu has an Italian leaning but they also have wings and burgers.

data.title: Amazing sunsets to be seen during dinner.
data.text: We saw the most beautiful sun set and had a great meal to boot on their pet friendly patio.  Patrons and staff were great

data.title: Nice patio, ok food
data.text: Nice to see more places opening up in downtown area. The atmosphere is nice and the patio is cool and dog friendly. Thought the food was pretty good though I think in most cases I would rather have a good pizza elsewhere.

data.title: Great Place to eat and drink before a concert!
data.text: We went before the "Coldplay" concert. Food was good and beer was cold! Service was fantastic even though it was crowded with the before concert crowd. Great place to stop before a BOK event!

data.title: Pronounced "brusketa"
data.text:
It is probably not fair for me to hit this restaurant with my first comment regarding the pronunciation of " bruschetta", but I can't take it anymore and this was the last straw for some reason. So I'm not totally discounting this place for that reason. 

The service was excellent. I sat at the bar and had a wonderful solo experience. The food was good. The bruschetta martini was  as expected but I don't venture far from original recipes so I asked sans balsamic. Beautiful presentation, good flavor but messy to eat. 

I also had the margherita pizza. They did spell it correctly on the menu. And it was good. I will come back next time I'm in the area. 

Overall I enjoyed the food and atmosphere. I would recommend it as an affordable and quaint downtown stop.

data.title: Good lunch; close to BOK
data.text:
Located across the street from BOK, this restaurant is in the heart of downtown Tulsa.    I had the lunch combo which included a lunch portion of flatbread and a side salad.   The salad was ok.   I tried the lime vinegarette dressing which sounded much better to me than it tasted.      I then asked (and quickly received) ranch dressing which was good.    

I chose be Mediterranean flatbread which included tomatoes, olives, spinach and cheese.   The flatbread was tasty and the toppings hot and fresh.   

Other items on the menu include sandwiches and pizza.   It's a good, casual dining restaurant with a contemporary decor.    

Our server was friendly and prompt.

data.title: Location, drinks and food were top notch!
data.text: We were staying at the Hyatt (just up the street) and saw that the reviews for this restaurant were fantastic.  We ordered bruschetta (the flatbread and tomato mix were out of this world) and a margarita pizza.  The portions were just right, service was excellent and atmosphere was enjoyable.  Would highly recommend!!

data.title: A must and go to....
data.text: I haven't tried everything on the menu, but I plan on it! Everything I have had in my 10+ visits is excellent. Always to order, food is high quality and amount is worth the price, which is fairly inexpensive. It is right across the street from the event center and they have special hours to accommodate the concert goers. Staff makes it a personal experience! Hard to find that these days. Jacqueline at the bar is my favorite, but rest assured the rest of the staff is great as well.

data.title: Great flatbreads!
data.text: We were return visitors this trip, and it was as good as we remembered. Full bar and yummy flatbreads!

data.title: Great place!
data.text: Wow this place is great! Right across the street from the BOK center, this is the perfect place to grab a quick bite before a concert or event. Menu is varied and delicious. Our waiter Ryan was top notch, very knowledgeable about the menu and has a relaxed and personal demeanor. Will definitely be back!

data.title: Stop only for apps
data.text: Yummy feta dip, less than impressive entrees. I would go back for drinks & tapas but not a big fan thought the drinks were great.

data.title: Great restaurant across from BOK
data.text: We enjoyed an early dinner before the concert.  I had pizza and my husband had a barbeque sandwich. Our food was good.  We would definitely go back.

data.title: A MUST!
data.text: Went here for lunch and were seated by the manager/owner for a fantastic lunch. The Captiva salad is most amazing with a perfect mix of apples, chicken, mango, craisins and caramelized pecans. The Graticola flat bread was flavorful and perfect size to share for a lunch. Server was attentive and personable. Can't wait to return!

data.title: This place rocks!
data.text: Great for late night wine and snack.  We loved it...great variety of beers and wines.  Ambiance speaks for itself!  Try it...you will not be disappointed

data.title: Love the place
data.text: Food is great, love sitting by window overlooking the BOK Center.  Ashley, Angela, and Courtney are wonderful waitresses, always make you feel at home and their service is always quick and courteous.

data.title: What a nice surprise!
data.text: We met some friends one evening to hear a local band, Rio.  We weren't expecting anything as far as food but 3 of us had different salads and my husband had the meatloaf and mashed potatoes.  Everything was delicious and oh my gosh, the salads were fresh, HUGE, and really good!  Highly recommend.  Our server was obviously quite new as she asked me if I would like to taste the wine first...she poured a tiny amount in my glass and as I am lifting the glass to taste it she poured my husband a full glass of wine.  It was more amusing than anything - she just had not been trained properly on wine pouring.  She was quite pleasant though.
